column4: Hello, I've been following the Karmic-changes mailing list archive, and I wonder, why have the accepted packages not yet appeared on the repositories?
do the new repositories need a while before they get the new packages?
which new packages?
linux 2.6.30-1.1, for example
karmic still have the jaunty version
try asking in #ubuntu+1
what version of ubuntu are you using?
and are you using jaunty's repos?
just stick with the jaunty repos
nah, I can afford to trash this installation :)
karmic has only been around for a couple weeks and it is still well below an alpha
've got it backed up neatly
yes, I know. but I'd like a > .29 kernel for kms etc
you could compile your own kernel but that isn't supported
yeah, I'll just wait for .30 to show up in karmic and then update the repos
do not use karmic repos on jaunty
I'd switch over completely or wait for the alpha
I'd personally wait for the release or the beta
my question was more of the sort: why do messages that appear on the karmic-changes list do not appear on packages.ubuntu.com
someone in #ubuntu+1 might know
I've been on jaunty since day one, it never broke for me, so that's ok
